<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Haunt Ingenuity](/Feats.aspx?ID=3701) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Thaumaturge" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=432" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 42</row>

</column>

---

Your cunning knowledge grants you the ability to notice the emotional echo of a soul that passed on, leaving a haunt in its wake. Even when you aren't [Searching](/Actions.aspx?ID=519) while in exploration mode, the GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) check for you to notice [haunts](/Traits.aspx?ID=88) that usually require you to be Searching.

 You can disable haunts that require master proficiency in a skill as long as you're at least trained in the skill. If you have master proficiency in the skill, you can disable haunts that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead.
name: Haunt Ingenuity
